sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Higher Education Technology Entrepreneur Center Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Higher Education Technology Entrepreneur Center Act.

sections.heading: Technology entrepreneur centers; creation
sections.text: The board of trustees of each public university and community college district in this State is authorized to create a technology entrepreneur center for each campus of the university or for each community college. In creating a center, the board of trust

sections.heading: Duties of center.  A technology entrepreneur center created under the authority of this Act shall provide material and personal infrastructure to selected innovators who possess an inventive concept that has not yet been offered for sale in the private-sector market, with the goal being to develop a
sections.text: Duties of center. A technology entrepreneur center created under the authority of this Act shall provide material and personal infrastructure to selected innovators who possess an inventive concept that has not yet been offered for sale in the private-sector market, with the goal being to develop a concept to the point where it can become a business venture. The concept may or may not have been patented or be patentable.
